title: pytorch dockerimage doesn't have torch installed for python and doesn't have pip
body_html:
PyTorch GitHub Issues Guidelines

We like to limit our issues to bug reports and feature requests. If you have a question or would like help and support, please visit our forums: https://discuss.pytorch.org/

If you are submitting a feature request, please preface the title with [feature request].

When submitting a bug report, please include the following information (where relevant):

  • OS:
  • PyTorch version:
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source):
  • Python version:
  • CUDA/cuDNN version:
  • GPU models and configuration:
  • GCC version (if compiling from source):

In addition, including the following information will also be very helpful for us to diagnose the problem:

  • A script to reproduce the bug. Please try to provide as minimal of a test case as possible.
  • Error messages and/or stack traces of the bug
  • Context around what you are trying to do

I'm going to ignore the above requirements because I'm dealing with an issue specifically regarding the dockerfile. I created my own image off of the image in this repo, and after everything built correctly, I've found that the image doesn't have pytorch installed for python, and also doesn't have pip. It feels like that really shouldn't be the case, in an image built around using python and pytorch.

Here is the docker file I built from:

FROM pytorch:latest
MAINTAINER Benjamin Genchel (benjiegenchel@gmail.com)
WORKDIR /root

RUN yes | apt-get -qq update
RUN yes | apt-get -qq -y install curl
RUN yes | apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends apt-utils
RUN yes | apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends libav-tools

RUN git clone https://github.com/bgenchel/.dotfiles.git
RUN ls -a ./.dotfiles
RUN chmod +x ./.dotfiles/docker_ubuntu_install_script.sh
RUN ./.dotfiles/docker_ubuntu_install_script.sh
RUN chsh -s $(which zsh)

RUN pip install librosa matplotlib
RUN pip install tensorflow-gpu tensorboard-logger
RUN pip install sox pyyaml

body:
PyTorch GitHub Issues Guidelines
--------------------------------

We like to limit our issues to bug reports and feature requests. If you have a question or would like help and support, please visit our forums: https://discuss.pytorch.org/

If you are submitting a feature request, please preface the title with [feature request].

When submitting a bug report, please include the following information (where relevant):
- OS:
- PyTorch version:
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source):
- Python version:
- CUDA/cuDNN version:
- GPU models and configuration:
- GCC version (if compiling from source):

In addition, including the following information will also be very helpful for us to diagnose the problem:
- A script to reproduce the bug. Please try to provide as minimal of a test case as possible.
- Error messages and/or stack traces of the bug
- Context around what you are trying to do

I'm going to ignore the above requirements because I'm dealing with an issue specifically regarding the dockerfile. I created my own image off of the image in this repo, and after everything built correctly, I've found that the image doesn't have pytorch installed for python, and also doesn't have pip. It feels like that really shouldn't be the case, in an image built around using python and pytorch.

Here is the docker file I built from:

`FROM pytorch:latest`
 `MAINTAINER Benjamin Genchel (benjiegenchel@gmail.com)`
 `WORKDIR /root`

 `RUN yes | apt-get -qq update`
 `RUN yes | apt-get -qq -y install curl`
 `RUN yes | apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends apt-utils`
 `RUN yes | apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends libav-tools`

 `RUN git clone https://github.com/bgenchel/.dotfiles.git`
 `RUN ls -a ./.dotfiles`
 `RUN chmod +x ./.dotfiles/docker_ubuntu_install_script.sh`
 `RUN ./.dotfiles/docker_ubuntu_install_script.sh`
 `RUN chsh -s $(which zsh)`

 `RUN pip install librosa matplotlib`
 `RUN pip install tensorflow-gpu tensorboard-logger`
 `RUN pip install sox pyyaml`
